summary: Saint-Paul Island is a part of the French Southern and Antarctic Territories, which are classified under the category of overseas countries and territories (OCTs) in EU legal and regulatory frameworks. As a redirect term, it highlights the relationship between the island and its broader territorial designation. The French Southern and Antarctic Territories, while not part of the European Union, are subject to specific EU regulations concerning trade, environmental protection, and territorial governance. This classification facilitates the application of EU policies and aids in the management of these remote territories, ensuring compliance with international obligations and sustainable development goals.
